summary: This bill, the Support UNFPA Funding Act, authorizes appropriations to the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) for fiscal years 2026 and 2027. It highlights UNFPA's work in promoting reproductive health, preventing maternal deaths, addressing unmet needs for contraception, and combating gender-based violence and harmful practices like female genital mutilation and child marriage. The bill emphasizes UNFPA's role in advancing U.S. foreign policy goals, supporting global health, and contributing to stability and economic development. It aims to provide at least $50 million in 2026 and $55 million in 2027 to support UNFPA's core functions.
